ru.jango.j0loader.image

Class ImageLoader

  • java.lang.Object
    • ru.jango.j0loader.DataLoader<android.graphics.Bitmap>
      • ru.jango.j0loader.image.ImageLoader

  • public class ImageLoader
extends DataLoader<android.graphics.Bitmap>
    Advanced lightweight image loader. Main features:
    • internal cache - by default images are cached in memory as encoded byte arrays (should be transformed into Bitmap with BitmapFactory.decodeByteArray(byte[], int, int, android.graphics.BitmapFactory.Options)); it takes some time to retrieve an image from cache then, but on the other hand pretty much data could be cached (encoded data is much smaller, than raw pixel data)
    • smart scaling - loader's clients could specify the desired image size and loader will automatically and asynchronously (in the downloading thread) scale images before passing it to clients; for scaling are used algorithms from ru.jango.j0util.BmpUtil

    Other features:
    • images are cached in already scaled size
    • only one instance of a single image could be cached - if clients try to load same image with different scales, would be selected a larger one and an image will be cached in this larger scale; if clients try to load an image that is already cached but in smaller scale, then the image would be reloaded, rescaled in new large scale and recached addToQueue(ru.jango.j0loader.Request, android.graphics.Point)
    • due to that, images could be retrieved from cache by it's URI, not a Request
    • cache is separated as a standalone class, so you can different caching strategies, or create your own (default is simple memory cache)
    • by default cache size is limited by DefaultCache.DEFAULT_MAX_CACHE_SIZE; be aware, that huge cache can cause OutOfMemoryError
    • loading from cache is transparent for clients - clients don't know was requested image cached or not (if it was, client just get required image faster)
    • loading is separated into default and cache threads and queues - defaults come from DataLoader and cache thread and queue are created and managed by ImageLoader itself

      • addToQueue

        public void addToQueue(Request request,
              android.graphics.Point scale)
        Adds an element into loading queues. Automatically checks cache and chooses a queue. Second parameter specifies a size, in witch image should be cached and returned to the client.

        If clients try to load a cached image, but with smaller scale, loader will return a cached image.

        If clients try to load a cached image, but with larger scale, loader will remove that image from cache, then reload it from URI, rescale into size, put again in cache and return it to the client.
        Parameters:
        request - a URI where to take the image
        scale - a size, in witch image should be cached and returned to the client; be aware, that max texture size in Android is 2048x2048, loader automatically handles appropriate scaling

      • removeFromQueue

        public void removeFromQueue(Request request)
        Description copied from class: DataLoader
        Removes a Request from the loading queue. If this Request is already being processed, it could be retrieved by DataLoader.getCurrentQueueElement() and the procession could be stopped by DataLoader.cancelCurrent() (stops only the current, not all queue).
        Overrides:
        removeFromQueue in class DataLoader<android.graphics.Bitmap>
        Parameters:
        request - a Request to remove

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the loader to it's initial clear state:
        • stop operations by DataLoader.stopWorking()
        • clear queue by DataLoader.clearQueue()
        • clear cache by Cache.clear()
        • clear queue queue by clearCacheQueue()
        Overrides:
        reset in class DataLoader<android.graphics.Bitmap>

        protected boolean scaleLarger(android.graphics.Point p1,

      • createQueue

        protected Queue createQueue()
        Description copied from class: DataLoader
        Special method for queue configuration. By default DataLoader creates an instance of DefaultQueue, but if a queue with different logic is required, it could be substituted here.

        This method with conjunction of Queue hierarchy defines a usual Iterator pattern.
        Overrides:
        createQueue in class DataLoader<android.graphics.Bitmap>
        Returns:
        loading queue instance

      • getCache

        public Cache getCache()
        Returns internal cache object. By default in ImageLoader it is DefaultCache. With help of setCache(ru.jango.j0loader.image.cache.Cache) you can manipulate the whole cache object at any time.

      • setCache

        public void setCache(Cache cache)
        Sets internal cache object. With help of getCache() you can manipulate the whole cache object at any time.

      • removeFromCacheQueue

        public void removeFromCacheQueue(Request request)
        Removes a Request from the cache loading queue. If this Request is already being processed, it could be retrieved by getCurrentCacheQueueElement() and the procession could be stopped by DataLoader.cancelCurrent() (stops only the current, not all queue).
        Parameters:
        request - a Request to remove

      • getCurrentCacheQueueElement

        public Request getCurrentCacheQueueElement()
        Returns current element in cache queue (witch is processed now) or null.

      • createCacheQueue

        protected Queue createCacheQueue()
        Special method for queue configuration. By default ImageLoader creates an instance of SingleURIQueue, but if a queue with different logic is required, it could be substituted here.

        This method with conjunction of Queue hierarchy defines a usual Iterator pattern.
        Returns:
        cache loading queue instance

      • getCacheLoaderThread

        protected java.lang.Thread getCacheLoaderThread()
        Returns a Thread where the cache queue is executed. In subclasses this method could be overwritten to provide another thread.
